WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?
A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: Arthur Wilson
Address: 1025 Easthope Ave.
Birthplace: Ontario (Grey County)

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1916
Where did you set up housekeeping? 2 - 3 - 4 - 5 - 6 - 7 - 8 - 9 - 10
Where had you been living before that? Manitoba, Regina
For how many people did you prepare meals? 2 - 3 - 4 - 5 - 6 - 7 - 8 - 9 - 10
How far was it to your nearest store? 10 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice a year
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Flour, beans, corn meal, rolled oats, flour
Baking powder, jam, dried fruit etc.
A few years later a small local store was started by P.J. Scott.

In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lb. sacks

How much did you use Graham flour?
Whole wheat flour?
Was flour milled locally? No
How far away? 100 miles
What year? 1920
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats?
What other grain products did you use? Corn meal, rolled oats, etc.
Cornmeal? Yes
Whole wheat? Yes
Farina? Yes
Other?

How did you grind it?
Wilson, Arthur
